title: Quiz 1: Foundations & History of Nursing
topicName: Unit One: Professionalism and Trends in Nursing
description: Assess your knowledge on the historical evolution of nursing and key figures like Florence Nightingale.

questions.question: Which war provided Florence Nightingale with the opportunity to organize nursing care and demonstrate the importance of sanitation?
questions.explanation: Florence Nightingale took a group of nurses to the Crimea War (1853-1856), where her interventions in sanitation drastically reduced the mortality rate.

questions.question: Florence Nightingale is affectionately known as the 'Lady with the ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: She was called the 'Lady with the Lamp' because she made rounds at night to check on wounded soldiers.
questions.hint: A source of light used before electricity.

questions.question: Which of the following are major contributions of Florence Nightingale to the nursing profession? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Established the first scientifically based nursing school
Emphasized the importance of environmental sanitation
Utilized statistics to improve health outcomes

questions.explanation: Nightingale established nursing education, revolutionized sanitation, and was a pioneer in using health statistics. Clara Barton founded the American Red Cross.
questions.hint: Think about education, hygiene, and data.

questions.question: Arrange the following historical periods of nursing in chronological order:
questions.explanation: Nursing evolved from intuitive care, to on-the-job apprenticeship, to formal education under Nightingale, to modern contemporary practice.

questions.question: Analyze the table below regarding historical views of nursing. Which era is best described by the 'Dark Period of Nursing'?

richContent.content:
Era CharacteristicsSocial Context
Nursing performed by prisoners and low-status womenReligious orders suppressed
Lack of education and hygieneLittle social value on nursing

questions.explanation: The Reformation period saw the closing of monasteries and hospitals, leading to the 'Dark Period' where nursing was performed by untrained, low-status individuals.

questions.question: Match the historical figure with their contribution:
questions.explanation: Nightingale (Modern Nursing), Barton (Red Cross), Seacole (Crimean/Jamaica), Wald (Public Health/Henry Street Settlement).

questions.question: Nursing has always been recognized as a distinct profession with a unique body of knowledge since the Middle Ages.
questions.explanation: Nursing was largely seen as a domestic duty or religious calling in the Middle Ages. It only began to emerge as a distinct profession with a body of knowledge in the mid-19th century.
questions.hint: Think about when formal nursing schools started.

questions.question: What is the term used to describe the primary focus of nursing, which involves concern for the well-being of others?
questions.explanation: Caring is considered the central essence and primary focus of the nursing profession.

questions.question: Read the definition below. Which theorist is responsible for this definition of nursing?

richContent.content: 'The unique function of the nurse is to assist the individual, sick or well, in the performance of those activities contributing to health or its recovery (or to peaceful death) that he would perform unaided if he had the necessary strength, will or knowledge.'

questions.explanation: This is the classic definition of nursing provided by Virginia Henderson in the 1960s.
questions.hint: She is often called the 'Nightingale of the 20th Century'.

questions.question: Evidence-Based Practice (EBP) integrates clinical expertise with the best available ___BLANK___ and patient values.
questions.explanation: EBP relies on the best available research/evidence to guide clinical decision-making.
